description:
The Marketing Director is a key leader on the Business Unit Leadership Team. This leader will guide the marketers to collaborate with the business teams to define and deliver brand and market-appropriate go-to-market strategies and plans, and develop and oversee marketing plans and initiatives.
• Additionally, the director leads the marketing team in the commercialization of sales and marketing programs across categories, partners with relevant agencies to build and implement marketing plans, identifies category-specific business-building opportunities; and works cross functionally to deliver sales and profit results through the delivery of the overarching brand/category/channel strategies.
• Oversees team and collaborates cross-functionally to develop a marketing plan for the furnishings category overall and priority channels/audiences
• Manages a team and partners with internal/external resources to oversee the execution of relevant Furnishings and Brand marketing initiatives including development of integrated campaigns and promotional programs, such as in-store merchandising signage or displays, co-branded campaigns and activations, retailer feature ads, end consumer and designer activations, and category-specific marketing support materials.
• Collaborates to identify insights gaps / opportunities and leverages research, data and insights to inform brand marketing and business unit initiatives including but not limited to innovation, go-to-market strategies, and communications: identifies consumer/trade research needs on an ongoing basis; and partners with research to interpret findings and make informed recommendations for action.

Experience
• At least 8 years of progressive brand and/or marketing management experience with consumer-facing brands including management of brand campaigns from conception through execution and optimization
• Experience in furnishings-focused and / or aesthetics-driven business strongly preferred
• Experience working with research and insights to inform strategic recommendations
• Experience developing campaigns that serve both B2C and B2B marketing goals
• Experience working on brand messaging and positioning
• Experience with introducing new products through a structured product development process
• Demonstrated experience using robust mix of marketing touchpoints to drive growth
• Experience in leading/working with cross-functional teams and managing people as direct reports
